contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Pancho & Lefty | Type = studio | Artist = [[Merle Haggard]] and [[Willie Nelson]] | Cover = MerleHaggard&WillieNelsonPancho&Lefty.jpg | Released = January 1983 | Recorded = November 1982, Pedernales Recording Studio, [[Spicewood, TX]] | Genre = [[Country music|Country]] | Length = 35:35 | Label = [[Epic Records|Epic]] | Producer = [[Merle Haggard]], [[Willie Nelson]], [[Chips Moman]] | Chronology = [[Merle Haggard]] | Last album = ''[[Goin' Home for Christmas]]''<br />(1982) | This album = '''''Pancho & Lefty'''''<br />(1983) | Next album = ''[[That's the Way Love Goes (Merle Haggard album)|That's the Way Love Goes]]''<br />(1983) }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}}<ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r92522}}</ref> | rev2 = [[Robert Christgau]] | rev2Score = (B+)<ref>http://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?id=1976&name=Merle+Haggard%2FWillie+Nelson</ref> }} '''''Pancho & Lefty''''' is a [[honky tonk music|honky tonk]] album by [[outlaw country|outlaw]] [[country music]]ians [[Merle Haggard]] and [[Willie Nelson]], released in [[1983 in music|1983]]. A blockbuster album, ''Pancho & Lefty'' dominated country music for the year and helped establish both artists as two of the best-selling and most critically acclaimed of the genre. Nelson and Haggard were two of [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]]'s biggest artists of the time, the former at his creative peak and the latter having just released a successful comeback (''[[Big City (Merle Haggard album)|Big City]]'') two years previously. The album's title track and number one country single is a cover of what was arguably the signature song of legendary country-folk singer/songwriter [[Townes Van Zandt]]. ==Track listing== #"[[Pancho and Lefty]]" ([[Townes van Zandt]]) #"It's My Lazy Day" ([[Smiley Burnette]]) #"My Mary" ([[Stuart Hamblen]], Jimmie Davis) #"Half a Man" (Willie Nelson) #"Reasons to Quit" (Merle Haggard) #"No Reason to Quit" (Dean Holloway) #"Still Water Runs the Deepest" (Jesse Ashlock) #"My Life's Been a Pleasure" (Ashlock) #"All the Soft Places to Fall" ([[Leona Williams]]) #"Opportunity to Cry" (Nelson) ==Personnel== *[[Merle Haggard]] – vocal, guitar *[[Willie Nelson]] – vocal, guitar *[[Grady Martin]] – guitar *[[Reggie Young]] – guitar *Lewis Talley – guitar *[[Chips Moman]] – guitar *Johnny Christopher – guitar *Mike Leech – bass *Gene Chrisman – drums *[[Johnny Gimble]] – fiddle, mandolin *Bobby Emmons – keyboards *Bobby Wood – keyboards *[[Mickey Raphael]] – harmonica *Don Markham – saxophone, trumpet ==Chart performance== ===Album=== {| class="wikitable" !
